gov.nih.nlm.ling.core

Class GappedMultiWord

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.core.AbstractSurfaceElement
      • gov.nih.nlm.ling.core.GappedMultiWord
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SurfaceElement, Node, java.lang.Comparable<SurfaceElement>

    public class GappedMultiWord
extends AbstractSurfaceElement
    Represents a textual unit with non-contiguous parts. It allows treating such units as single entities. This, in turn, enables us to treat terms like diabetes mellitus type 1 and 2 as two units diabetes mellitus type 1 and diabetes mellitus type 2. Currently, this class is not used much, but there is no reason we can't.
    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

    • Constructor Detail

      • GappedMultiWord

        public GappedMultiWord(java.util.List<SurfaceElement> ases)
        Creates a GappedMultiWord from a list of textual units.
        Parameters:
        ases - the list of textual units (contiguous or gapped)

      • GappedMultiWord

        public GappedMultiWord(java.util.List<SurfaceElement> ases,
                       int primaryIndex)
        Creates a GappedMultiWord from a list of textual units and assigns one of these units as primary. The idea is that syntactic/semantic characteristics of the multi-word expressions will be inherited from this primary unit. The primary unit is the first one by default.
        Parameters:
        ases - the list of textual units (contiguous or gapped)
        primaryIndex - the index of the primary textual unit

      • setHead

        public void setHead(Word w)
        Sets the head for a gapped multi-word.

        This essentially amounts to setting the primaryItemIndex and setting the head of the contiguous unit with the primary item index.

        Parameters:
        w - the head word to set
